result.execSummary:
The defendant Michael Johnson was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • OWI (4th w/in 5 yrs), a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 346.63(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Milwaukee County Clerk of Circuit Court

supervisions.notes: Any vehicle owned/operated by the defendant

miscConds.notes:
Pay a fine of $2400.00 plus all costs and surcharges including DNA and IID surcharge out of up to 25% of prison wages or, if not paid, convert to a civil judgment.
- Provide a DNA sample; pay DNA surcharge.

Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may never possess a firearm. Court advised defendant that his voting rights are suspended and he may not vote in any election until his civil rights are restored.

CONDITIONS OF PROBATION:
- Obtain a AODA assessment and follow-up treatment.
- Maintain absolute sobriety with random urine screens.
- Pay the IID surcharge or, if not paid convert to a civil judgment.
- Pay the fine of $1200.00 plus all costs and surcharges and the IID surcharge in case 14CM4616 out of up to 25% or prison wages or, if not paid, convert to a civil judgment

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Michael Johnson

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: of letter to defendant; no return address.
Decision and Order Denying Request for Modification of Condition Time, signed and filed.
Per order of the Presiding Judge, Misdemeanor Division, this request/motion is hereby assigned to Hon. Janet C. Protasiewicz, Br. 24, for review. jbs
Defendant's pro se request for a reduced sentence.

Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing.  Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed.  Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Original Information filed.  Copy given to defense counsel who waived reading.

Defendant Michael Johnson in court with attorney Brian Christopher Hagner.  Defendant Michael Johnson in custody.  Francesco Mineo appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk ssm.  Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings.
Defendant is Out-of-Custody. Court appearance in Courthouse, Room 622 on 6/12/15 @ 1:30 pm
